title: Cuomo expected to face questions from attorney general over sexual harassment allegations
description: New York Gov. Andrew Cuomo is expected to face questions on Saturday from members of the New York state attorney general's office related to their investigation into sexual harassment allegations against him, a source familiar with the investigation told CNN.

title: Goose has an adorable reaction when mate has surgery
description: Talk about lovebirds ... one goose shows up to watch her mate's surgery. CNN's Jeanne Moos reports she just won't quit him.

title: How America's top general went from Trump's hand-picked favorite to one of his harshest critics
$3 million domed home (that comes with indoor slide) goes up for sale
description: A unique Minnesota house built in 1977 by two doctors is up for sale and is listed under $3 million. CNN affiliate KARE has the details.

title: Biden calls Cuba a 'failed state' and communism 'a universally failed system'
description: President Joe Biden said on Thursday that Cuba is a "failed state" and called communism a "failed system" as protests play out against the Caribbean nation's repressive regime.

title: Djokovic keeps Golden Slam in play with announcement he'll compete in Olympics
description: World No. 1 Novak Djokovic announced on social media on Thursday that he will compete in the Tokyo Olympics.

title: Woman qualifies for US Naval Special Warfare Command crew for first time
description: A woman qualified to become a part of the Naval Special Warfare Command crew for the first time in the organization's history, according to a press release from the US Navy Thursday.

title: Merkel's meeting with Biden marks final goodbye to Washington
description: President Joe Biden and German Chancellor Angela Merkel are set to meet in Washington on Thursday in what is likely the European leader's final appearance at the White House before she steps down from her long-held position this fall.

title: Inside a Louisiana hospital with most Covid-19 patients in state
description: Our Lady of Lourdes Regional Medical Center in Lafayette, Louisiana, has the highest number of Covid-19 patients in the state. CNN's Miguel Marquez gets a look inside the hospital.

title: 18-year-old to go to space with Jeff Bezos after $28M auction winner backs out
description: The mystery bidder who put up a whopping $28 million for an 11-minute joy ride to the edge of space alongside Jeff Bezos will not make the trip, Bezos' rocket company Blue Origin announced Thursday.

title: DeChambeau 'living on the razor's edge' at the Open, but for now his driver 'sucks'
description: The crowds slowly grasp who is on the tee box and the whispers intensify.

title: Megyn Kelly claims media exaggerated the Capitol riot
description: Former Fox News anchor Megyn Kelly said in a podcast "the media represented [January 6] as so much worse than it actually was." CNN Editor-at-large Chris Cillizza breaks down why that's dead wrong.

title: Video shows widespread damage from catastrophic floods
description: Flooding in Germany, Belgium, the Netherlands and Luxembourg has caused devastation and claimed at least 40 lives in Germany and six in Belgium.

title: Lebanon's Hariri steps down as PM-designate, pushing country further into crisis
description: Lebanon's Prime Minister-designate Saad Hariri has stepped down nearly nine months after he was tasked with forming the crisis-ridden country's next government.

title: US sues Amazon for selling dangerous products
description: The US Consumer Product Safety Commission says Amazon is selling hazardous products to its customers. The federal safety watchdog is suing Amazon to stop.

title: 2 bodies found in the former Versace mansion
description: Two men were found dead inside a hotel room at the former Gianni Versace mansion in Miami Beach on Wednesday afternoon, police said.

title: 'You f**king did this': Liz Cheney rips Jim Jordan after Capitol riot
description: A new book details a phone call between Rep. Liz Cheney (R-WI) and Gen. Mark Milley the day after the Capitol insurrection, in which Cheney told Milley what she experienced on the House floor on January 6, including a run-in with Rep. Jim Jordan (R-OH), a staunch Trump ally in the House who feverishly tried to overturn the election.

title: Smithsonian receives biggest gift in museum's history from Jeff Bezos
description: The Smithsonian said Thursday that Jeff Bezos will donate $200 million to the museum, the largest gift the institution has received since its founding in 1846.

title: NASA begins high-stakes repair to Hubble Space Telescope
description: NASA engineers are trying to work their magic on the Hubble Space Telescope, which stopped working on June 13 as a result of a problem with the payload computer on board.

title: Trump and McCarthy to meet as Jan. 6 hearing looms
description:
• Top generals feared Trump would attempt coup after election
• Analysis: Trump revelations signal danger

title: Dutch crime journalist Peter R. de Vries dies in hospital
description: Dutch crime journalist Peter R. de Vries has died in hospital, according to CNN affiliate RTL News and a statement by his family published by national broadcaster NOS.

title: Microsoft is bringing back Clippy
description: Clippy hasn't had an easy life. Microsoft's iconic but polarizing virtual assistant first appeared in Windows 97 as a small paper clip to help Microsoft Office users. It was given the boot by Office 2007.

title: The UK has a new $33 billion tech giant
description: There's a new super-unicorn in the United Kingdom.

title: Delta variant surges in Middle East and North Africa as region braces for 'catastrophic consequences'
description: The Middle East and North Africa is witnessing a surge in Covid-19 cases aggravated by the Delta variant of the virus -- and it may get worse over coming weeks -- according to the World Health Organization (WHO).

title: One of the biggest names in craft beer is hopping over to the cannabis business
description: Nearly 20 years ago, a batch of hand-canned beers started a seismic shift in the craft beer industry. Now the man behind that endeavor is turning his attention to hand-cultivated cannabis.

title: Chrissy Teigen opens up about depression after becoming part of the 'cancel club'
description: Chrissy Teigen is feeling "lost" these days.

title: Cuba lifts customs restrictions on food and medicine after biggest protests in decades
description: Cuba announced on Wednesday it was temporarily lifting restrictions on travelers bringing food, medicines and hygiene products into the country in an apparent acknowledgment of demands from anti-government demonstrators.

title: Cities in South Africa left gutted after unprecedented violence and looting
description: CNN's David McKenzie reports from Soweto, South Africa, on the devastating aftereffects of looting and protests that took place in parts of the country. Protests erupted last week as former South African President Jacob Zuma, 79, turned himself in to authorities to serve a 15-month jail term for contempt of court. At least 72 have died in some of the worst violence the country has seen in years.

title: 'Shocking, but not surprising': George Conway reacts to Trump book excerpt
description: Conservative attorney George Conway reacts to an excerpt from a new book that alleges top military official Gen. Mark Milley feared former President Trump would attempt a coup following his 2020 election loss.

title: Remember when Diana Ross wowed Central Park in glittering jumpsuits?
description: They say rain can be a sign of good luck. And it certainly was -- in hindsight, at least -- for Diana Ross when a torrential rainstorm struck during her televised Central Park performance on the evening of July 21, 1983.

title: He lost his home to the Olympics. Twice.
description: As the Tokyo Olympics get underway, there are some who are not happy about Japan's investment and others who can't wait. CNN's Will Ripley reports from Tokyo, Japan.

title: Airline switches to gender-neutral plane greetings
description: German airline group Lufthansa will greet fliers using gender-neutral language from now on.

title: Tennessee's former vaccine manager said she was sent a dog muzzle before she was fired
description: Tennessee's former vaccine manager said she received a dog muzzle in the mail before she was fired.

title: Lyft is bringing back a version of shared rides
description: Shared rides were a key part of how the founders of Uber and Lyft envisioned disrupting transportation. Back in 2014, the companies raced each other to be first to announce their carpooling options, with the promise of creating a more efficient service that's also more affordable for riders.

title: Tennessee doctors want investigation into state's handling of pandemic
description: CNN's Martin Savidge gives a deeper look at Tennessee's political battle over the handling of coronavirus vaccinations after the state health department temporarily halted all adolescent vaccine outreach, even for vaccines not related to Covid-19.

title: Cocaine disguised as charcoal worth up to $41 million seized by police
description: Cocaine disguised as charcoal with an estimated street value of up to 35 million euros ($41.4 million) has been seized in a joint operation between Irish and Dutch authorities.

title: Foo Fighters postpone concert after confirmed Covid-19 case
description: Weeks after the Foo Fighters played the first capacity show at Madison Square Garden, they have announced they must postpone their Los Angeles concert due to a confirmed case of Covid-19 within their organization.

title: Mastercard has been banned from issuing new cards in India
description: Mastercard has been ordered to stop taking new customers in India, as authorities there say it violated the country's rules on how data should be stored.

title: India is bombarding Twitter with user data requests and demands to remove content
description: Twitter is under enormous pressure in India this year. But even before the country rolled out strict new rules for tech firms, the company was hit by a wave of requests from the government to remove content or provide user data.

title: Abandoned towns offer a glimpse of Qatar's humble past
description: Past the small arched door, a narrow spiral stair leads up to the top of the windswept minaret, still standing tall even as almost everything around it has crumbled.

title: These apps are trying to put car dealers out of business
description: City dwellers are used to switching between apps to decide the best way to get from A to B. Is it quickest to get the train or the bus? What about a taxi or a city bike? Which provider has the nearest e-scooter?

title: Amazon rainforest emitting more carbon dioxide than it absorbs in some areas
description: Parts of the Amazon rainforest are now emitting more carbon dioxide than they absorb, raising fears of the potentially devastating impact on its fragile ecosystems and a further worsening of the climate crisis, according to a new study.

title: Head of security at Haiti's presidential residence in police custody
description: The head of security at Haiti's presidential residence has been placed in police custody, according to a close associate, as authorities continue to investigate the assassination of Haitian President Jovenel Moise.

title: Bucks rally to defeat Suns, level NBA Finals series at 2-2
description: The Milwaukee Bucks rallied from nine points down in the fourth quarter to defeat the Phoenix Suns 109-103 in Game 4 of the NBA Finals on Wednesday to tie the best-of-seven series at 2-2 in front their own elated fans at Fiserv Forum.

title: Royal Caribbean is not responsible for toddler's 2019 cruise ship death, judge rules
description: Royal Caribbean Cruises is not responsible for the death of an 18-month-old girl who fell from her grandfather's arms through a window on a cruise ship, a judge ruled Tuesday.

title: Brain implant helps paralyzed man 'speak' using just his thoughts and a computer
description: A brain implant has helped restore a type of speech to a man more than 15 years after a stroke robbed him of the ability to speak, researchers reported Wednesday.

title: Retired soldier claims 26 Colombians accused in Haiti assassination were actually hired to protect the President
Biden administration looks to set up emergency 'red phone' to China
description: The Biden administration is examining the possibility of setting up an emergency hotline with the Chinese government similar to the so-called "red phone" established between the US and the Soviet Union during the Cold War, which allowed for direct communication with the Kremlin as a way to avert nuclear war.

title: At this museum exhibition, the security guards are the curators
description: Museum security officers, the people who probably spend the most time looking at art, will soon be organizing an exhibition at the Baltimore Museum of Art (BMA) as guest curators.
